claim: Venus is the closest planet to the Sun

supporting.text: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, with an average distance of approximately 58 million kilometers.

attacks.text: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, with an average distance of approximately 58 million kilometers.
Venus is sometimes closer to the Sun than Mercury due to Mercury's highly elliptical orbit.
On average, Mercury's orbit remains the closest to the Sun despite its eccentricity, as Venus's orbit is consistently farther.
Transient proximity during orbital phases does not negate Mercury's status as the closest planet by average distance.

supporting.text: Venus is the second planet from the Sun, with an average distance of approximately 108 million kilometers.

attacks.text: Venus is the second planet from the Sun, with an average distance of approximately 108 million kilometers.

supporting.text: Astronomical observations and measurements consistently place Mercury as the innermost planet in the Solar System.

attacks.text: Astronomical observations and measurements consistently place Mercury as the innermost planet in the Solar System.

Modern telescopic and space probe data have conclusively corrected these historical errors, confirming Mercury's position.

Visibility does not determine orbital distance, and precise measurements override apparent brightness observations.

supporting.text: NASA and other space agencies have confirmed Mercury's position as the closest planet to the Sun through multiple missions and data collection.

attacks.text: NASA and other space agencies have confirmed Mercury's position as the closest planet to the Sun through multiple missions and data collection.

supporting.text: Textbooks and educational resources universally list Mercury as the first planet from the Sun, not Venus.
